SEARCH
Package jpacman.model

Class BoardTest

java.lang.Object
jpacman.model.BoardTest
public class BoardTest extends Object
One of the simpler test classes, so a good point to start understanding how testing JPacman has been setup.
Version:
$Id: BoardTest.java,v 1.10 2008/02/03 19:43:38 arie Exp $
Author:
Arie van Deursen; Jul 29, 2003

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    setUp()
    Create a simple (empty) board to be used for testing.
    void
    testFailingBoardCreation()
    Try to create an illegal board (e.g., negative sizes), and verify that this generates an assertion failure.
    void
    testGettingCellsFromBoard()
    Obtain a cell that is on the board at given (x,y) position, and check if the (x,y) coordinates of the Cell obtained are ok.
    void
    testGettingWidthHeight()
    Simple test of the width/height getters, to get in the mood for testing.
    void
    testOccupy()
    Let a guest occupy one of the Cells on the board, and check if it is actually there.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardTest

      public BoardTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Create a simple (empty) board to be used for testing. Note that JUnit invokes such a Before method before every test case so that we start in a fresh situation.

    • testGettingWidthHeight

      public void testGettingWidthHeight()
      Simple test of the width/height getters, to get in the mood for testing.

    • testGettingCellsFromBoard

      public void testGettingCellsFromBoard()
      Obtain a cell that is on the board at given (x,y) position, and check if the (x,y) coordinates of the Cell obtained are ok. To make the test a little more exciting use a point that is on the border (an "invariant on point" in Binder's terminology).

    • testOccupy

      public void testOccupy()
      Let a guest occupy one of the Cells on the board, and check if it is actually there. Again, pick a point on the border (but a different one) to (slightly) increase the chances of failure.

    • testFailingBoardCreation

      public void testFailingBoardCreation()
      Try to create an illegal board (e.g., negative sizes), and verify that this generates an assertion failure. This test also serves to illustrate how to test whether a method generates an assertion failure if a precondition is violated.
